pros: They have really good benefits.
cons: I do not have any cons.

job_title: Medical Assistant in Walla Walla, WA
pros: Work with a culturally diverse population Fair pay Option to work 4 tens Shift differential for people who work until 7pm
cons: Managers don’t stay long Hard workers are given more work, less motivated employees are given easier work Increasing demands from management Favoritism from managers No support for overworked employees Pay could be better given work expectations

pros: Back office works well as a team. MA’s have been there longer than most providers and can be a great resource regarding patients’ histories. Able to work directly with a dietician and community health worker, sometimes a behavioral health worker, and a psychiatric nurse practitioner. Pay has improved in the last four years- going from 88k base to 101k base. Health insurance and benefits are GOOD! New CEO, Christy Trotter, has started making positive changes, so time will tell.
cons: High provider turnover due to patient complexity and pace of clinic day. Upper management is not incentivized to improve because there will always be freshly graduated providers who don’t understand yet that quantity does not equal quality.

review_title: Patients are more than just money.
pros: Team work amongst co-workers was great.
cons: Management leaves a lot to be desired.

job_title: Dental Residency Manager in Yakima, WA
pros: Department personnel in my department are very good.
cons: Significant lack of upper management support. Too caught up in bottom line dollar…

pros: Good benefits dental/healthcare no 401k
cons: Underpaid staff and over worked

pros: Clinic experience and lots of hours available due to poor staffing.
cons: They entise you with loan forgiveness that you can't really get as a RN. The expectations are very unrealistic. The VP breathes fire and creates an atmosphere of fear and chaos. Very stressful 'the sky is falling' vibe that come about due to poor exicution of new policy, poor planning and poor staffing. Pushing for unsafe and fast practices due to staffing and poor planning. Employees get blamed for their performance but are not set up for success. Training is minimal and they rush you out to work due to need vs safety. They don't pay well and change schedules on employees. No work life balance. Expect to be told you have to work weekends or late bc they forgot to schedule staffing.

job_title: HIM Imaging Coordinator in Yakima, WA
pros: Good benefits, PTO and employee services.
cons: Lower pay and very repetitive work.

review_title: Great people + terrible senior level management
pros: Wonderful coworkers - you’ll meet the best people who will become life long friends. You really do help people who have limited resources and options.
cons: Mismanaged and disorganized; stuck in the past and won’t adjust to new ways of doing things and treating employees; C-suite say they are focused on patients but in reality extremely profit-driven. Huge favoritism and difficult to be promoted and grow.

pros: nice place, no real downside
cons: Can get repetitive at times

pros: A lot of job opportunities
cons: They’re is favoritism in most departments

review_title: Good for leadership positions, medical staff, and providers but not much for admin staff and front office staff
pros: The organization provides a great care services for low income population and community so really good for people who have passion to help others. They pay pretty good for medical staff and the leadership position.
cons: if you are looking to work for front office or regular admin that is not manager, the pay is not really not much compared to the other competitors in the PDX metro area even after the wage adjustment.

pros: YVFWC is a good place to work overall. They really have a mission-oriented approach and the heart of Carlos and senior leadership is in the right place. YVFWC is the kind of company that is dedicated to underserved populations and often provides services that are not reimburseable because it's the right thing to do. While it varies from clinic to clinic, it often feels like a "big family" type of environment with good people rallied around the same mission. Carlos' (YVFWC's CEO) is passionate about the community and is willing to take calculated risks to be the best in healthcare. The company is committed to actually providing good care and not just checking the boxes.
cons: Because the company is so mission focused and the federal funding can fluctuate, YVFWC relies on high productivity from their medical providers. Sometimes this causes burnout and frustration and causes a divide between clinical and administrative employees. That said, the providers are given adequate resources such as dietitians, behavioral health providers, and community health workers so they are not isolated in caring for their patients. These resources help shoulder the burden for the providers even though the volumes expectations may be high.

pros: Mission, CEO is great and Accredited
cons: Clinic management lacks leadership skills

pros: Great Supervisor and coworkers; nice camaraderie.
cons: Not enough transparency when considering change

job_title: Behavioral Health Consultant in Hermiston, OR
pros:
Loan repayment
Wonderful and diverse patient population
Opportunity for primary care behavioral health experience
cons:
Extremely poor behavioral health leadership
History of unethical behavior from past residency supervisors and former team leads
Negative response from leadership when addressing low salary
Held to productivity standards but not compensated and incentivized as such when the medical providers were
BHCs are not a part of any of the leadership teams or decision making process
Confusing chain of command
High turnover
High variance of quality of leadership and receptiveness to BHC presence by clinic

pros: Fair compensation, good team, lots of flexibility
cons: Little disorganized, but good people and good mission.

pros:

pros: Working with people and helping them meet their goals was very rewarding.
cons: The Contract, grant was for 5 years that went by very quickly:(

review_title: Amazing services for the community/Unhealthy work Environment
pros: You can find great pride in the work you do assisting the community at large
cons: The micromanagement and mismanagement of the organization is astounding.  Growth is the only focus while the time and infrastructure required to make that growth efficient and effective is regularly ignored causing immense dissatisfaction.

pros: Located in a beautiful area of the Yakima Valley within driving distance of nice wineries and also within a decent driving distance to Chinook Pass and Mt. Rainier.
cons: Big disparity in income gap. Thread bear middle class between high income and working poor. Housing is more expensive than in like communities in other similar US farming locations. Organizationally speaking, YVFWC seemed disorganized and their expectations for this demographic area are unreasonable.

pros: I have worked for YVFWC for over 7 years. The reason I have stayed at YVFWC is because of the tremendous impact we have on the underserved communities we serve. The patient stories we hear about from time-to-time describe their positive experiences with our staff and providers. We are often the only opportunity for healthcare for many people in our service areas. the other thing that has kept me here is the quality and commitment of our healthcare providers. We have many very well-trained providers who choose to work for us because of the patient population we serve and the quality healthcare we are able to provide. Hearing the stories of our providers and why they choose to work for us is inspiring and motivating.
cons: Because YVFWC has grown quickly we lack adequate administrative space.

pros:
Our values TRUST, INTEGRITY, TRANSPARENCY, PARTNERSHIP, JUST TREATMENT, JOY, and COURAGE. The people who work for YVFWC try their best to apply the organization values into their daily work life. 
There is an atmosphere of caring for each other and the people that we serve. 
We recognize when someone has done a 'job well done'. We encourage growth and improvement by seeing the positive in each individual.
I am blessed to be a part of Yakima Valley Farm Workers Clinic.
cons: As with all organizations there are always ways to improve. I stated in the pros that we try our best to apply YVFWC values to our daily work life. What I see and have experienced is we need to concentrate more on transparency.

pros: I work with ivy league providers that have dedicated their lives to service of those who need it most. My coworkers are kind, professional, and inspiring. Supervisors are thoughtful and welcome feedback. This organization has gone through a transformation in the recent past and now very much follows it's core values: trust, integrity, transparency, justice, joy and courage.  This organization is one of the best nonprofit health care providers I've ever had the pleasure of working for.
cons: The need of our patients will always outstrip our ability to serve them. It can be frustrating to not be able to do more for our communities. Also, because the work is so important, we often put in long hours.

pros: You get to work with great staff!  The IT staff are all hard working very smart people that do everything they can to make things right.
cons:
You have to work with management that are more than willing to lie to your face, take credit for everything, and blame the employees for everything.

The IT management do not seem to understand the systems that are in place or what it takes to run them.  I am  not sure any of of the IT management has ever really worked in a technical IT role prior to being awarded their management position.  This starts at the supervisor level and goes all the way up.  So far, none of the good supervisors have stayed more than a couple years due to the incompetence of the management.

review_title: Great place to work...depending on department
pros:
Great Benefits for all workers
2 weeks of PTO in the first year 
Depending on department has supportive supervisors (not the case in every department)
Decent sick leave
cons: Extended Sick leave can only be used after you've used at least 2 days of PTO (so if grammy is sick it's better to take a month off than a couple weeks here and there).

review_title: Medical Assistant Certified - I LOVE MY JOB! GREAT COMPANY!
job_title: Certified Medical Assistant in Toppenish, WA
pros: I love my job and pay. It is the highest pay that I ever made.  When I started working at YVFWC, I got a retention bonus for $4000. I am so blessed......  Also, I get 100% paid long term disability benefit, medical plan, and 20 PTO days per year!
cons: Workflows are quite different here, but I love the clinic and its mission.

review_title: Unfortunately, not a supportive company environment.
pros: The salary is competitive for the location.
cons: Significant micromanagement issues, inefficient workflow in nearly every department, and an absolutely critical communication challenge both within a single department as well as interdepartmentally.

review_title: The health of one person is the health of humanity.
job_title: Human Resources Office Assistant in Terrace Heights, WA
pros: We are the voice for our communities, we take pride in offering the best services to our client and patients.
cons: One con is work/life balance, when you are dedicated to work you often take it home (both intentionally and unintentionally). Another con is having employees who do not embrace our Mission, Vision and Values.

pros: Good benifits  good experience patients really appreciate. The care they receive you will get to learn Lots of different procedure work with different dentist so you can see how you work with different people you will pick up spanish quickly
cons: Working with multiple dentists can be challenging you will need to learn each ones likes an dislikes room set ups differ between each doctor you can not save every salable tooth as most pt are on goverment assistance

pros: Mission driven, competitive compensation, frequent soft skills training for supervisors offered, constant desire to grow and evolve to meet the needs of patients
cons: YVFWC is growing rapidly. You have to be able to adapt to new changes or you wont be happy.

pros: Decent pay and benefits. Room to move up if you are willing to play the games.
cons: Bad management with questionable ethics and business practices. Micromanagement is the tool of choice and is used without reserve.

job_title: RN Staff Nurse in Hermiston, OR
pros: RNs could use call in translation assistance,  and Medical Assistants were required to speak Spanish - and tried to avail themselves to help translate as often as possible.
cons: Overtime is expected, and not appreciated - frequently to always understaffed with RNs.

review_title: Inspiring, flexible & generous place to work
pros: We get the opportunity to to serve and make a difference to so many people in our community. We have open-minded management that provide excellent leadership. Our diverse staff is extremely thoughtful, intelligent & inspiring.
cons: There is always room for improvement in taking the time to recognize the employees who do stellar work.

pros: Great place to work and get experience
cons: Off the beaten path in Toppenish, WA

pros: The insurance they give the families is amazing, and the worker is for free

review_title: It has been very challenging to stay positive

review_title: DON'T WORK AT THE MENTAL HEALTH PROGRAM
